Windows 8 Notification Client for Metro Apps

Introduction

The Windows 8 Notification Client for Metro Apps lets client devices open and register a channel (and close/unregister) with a server that handles registrations and can deliver notifications to them using the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS). If you want to create a notification server, you can leverage the WindowsAzure.Notifications NuGet.

This package includes a class library that contains the WinRT component that handles this process. By default, the registration service is called anonymously, but you can add additional headers with authentication tokens.

The library can be used in Metro apps created on any of the following platforms: Native/Managed/Script.

Prerequisites

  • Windows 8 Consumer Preview or later
  • Microsoft Visual Studio 11 Beta or later (for Windows 8 Consumer Preview or later)
